summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing the Victim Notification System (VNS) for the Epstein case. It involves coordinating the import and cross-checking of victim lists between the Miami (MM) and New York (NY) investigations, with attachments containing victim data spreadsheets.

persons.name: Canduce
persons.context: An intern in the FBI office who has been assisting with the victim list for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Staci Harris
persons.context: Provided a victim list that is being cross-checked against the list in the Victim Notification System.

persons.name: Jackson
persons.context: Copied on an email regarding coordinating the import of the Miami victim list with Victim Services.

connections.description: Both are involved in managing victim lists for the Epstein investigation, with Canduce assisting and Harris providing data.

events.title: Coordination of Epstein Victim Lists
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails to cross-check and import victim lists from the Miami (MM) investigation into the New York (NY) case's Victim Notification System.

keyFacts: The FBI uses a Victim Notification System (VNS) tied to multiple agencies (FBI, USAO, BOP, USPIS, Marshals) to notify victims of federal crimes and track cases.
There is an effort to consolidate victim lists from separate Epstein investigations in Miami (case 31E-MM-108062) and New York.
Attachments include a 'Contact Report' from VNS, a 'TOTAL VICTIM' list from a Special Agent, and a 'review' spreadsheet identifying victims still needing to be added to VNS.
The email highlights internal FBI coordination to ensure all identified victims are properly registered in the notification system.
